meanings.definition: A commander of a thousand soldiers in ancient Greece or Rome.
meanings.sent1: The chiliarchs led a group of one thousand soldiers into battle.
meanings.sent2: The chiliarchs were responsible for organizing and commanding large military units.
meanings.sent3: The chiliarchs decided to have a chili cook-off to boost morale among the soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The chiliarchs' authority over the troops was as strong as the aroma of a spicy chili.
meanings.sent5: The chiliarchs' presence on the battlefield was as powerful as a thousand soldiers marching in unison.

meanings.definition: A military officer in charge of a thousand men.
meanings.sent1: Each chiliarchs oversaw the training of one thousand soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The chiliarchs were respected leaders among the troops under their command.
meanings.sent3: The chiliarchs organized a surprise party for the soldiers to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: The chiliarchs' influence over the soldiers was as significant as a thousand voices united.
meanings.sent5: The chiliarchs' orders echoed through the ranks like the sound of a thousand marching feet.

meanings.definition: A leader of a thousand troops.
meanings.sent1: The chiliarchs strategized the movements of a large army.
meanings.sent2: As chiliarchs, they were responsible for the well-being of a thousand troops.
meanings.sent3: The chiliarchs organized a team-building retreat for the soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The chiliarchs' guidance was as crucial as a beacon for a thousand lost souls.
meanings.sent5: The chiliarchs' presence on the battlefield was as commanding as a thousand flags waving in the wind.
